parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of muo; a secret or 'mystery'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From paraballo; a similitude, i.e. fictitious narrative, apothegm or adage.
